column4: i cannot use my logitech webcam with skype under ubuntu 9.10, this has been so for some of the previous releases too, although it worked fine under 8.04, is it only my impression that ubuntu is actually getting worse?
it does detect it, but when i test it, nothing appears and cpu goes up close to 100%
i have two logitech cams, both used to work okay, now i cannot use either
i have tried loading libraries, changing xml con file, reverting to earlier versions, installing static version from medibuntu; no luck
anybody here who can help me using my logitech cam with skype in 10.04?
yes cheese can use the cam, but CPU load is 100%, so it's practically useless
which process usues most cpu when trying to use the webcam?
quick google shows it could be pulse autio related
try disabling auto-respawn, kill pulse audio and test if the issue persists
i wonder how video and audio is connected, but thanks, i'll do just what you suggest
check it out, maybe it'll help
i've tried killing pulseaudio, the problem remains; the forum thread you sent me is not about skype video
